nodes.name: Junction Right of Power Bomb Blocks
Junction Left of Power Bomb Blocks
G-Mode Morph, Left of Morph Tunnel (Off-Camera)
nodes.note: Represents being left of the morph tunnel with G-Mode and morph or artificial morph

strats.name: Wait for Kzan and Leave With Runway
Ride Kzan and Leave With Runway
strats.note: Ride the Spike Platform up and back down again to more easily position for using it as a runway.

strats.name: SpaceJump
strats.devNote: FIXME: Heat count assumes the Kzan is blocking your path.

strats.name: Tricky Platforming
strats.devNote: FIXME: Heat count assumes the Kzan is blocking your path.

strats.name: G-Mode
strats.note: Climb the room and place a Power Bomb near the top before exiting G-mode.
devNote: It is possible to do this with artificial morph, but progressing anywhere else in the room requires Morph.
FIXME: It looks like the heat frames going up from 5 don't take into account that the Power Bomb blocks could already be broken.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph, Simple Blind Movement
strats.note: Get into the cove next to the bomb block and carefully wiggle in that camera scroll block to overload PLMs and move to the item to the left.
devNote: It is possible to damage boost off of the Hibashi instead of requiring artificial morph movement,
but there is no known way to get here with Energy and artificial morph (a Power Bomb will solidify the bomb block).

strats.name: G-Mode Morph, Simple Blind Movement, Activate Shutter
note: Get into the cove next to the bomb block and carefully wiggle in that camera scroll block to overload PLMs and move to the item to the left.
Then use a Power Bomb to activate the shutter.
devNote: It is possible to damage boost off of the Hibashi instead of requiring artificial morph movement,
but there is no known way to get here with Energy and artificial morph (a Power Bomb will solidify the bomb block).

strats.name: G-Mode, Simple Blind Movement, Activate Shutter
note: Raise the shutter by shooting a missile or upgraded beam at it.
Stand on the right side of lowest safe tile and shoot diagonally down while crouched if using missiles, or standing otherwise.
A basic beam shot will work if fired vertically down, onto the side of the spike.
Then, get into the cove next to the bomb block and carefully wiggle in that camera scroll block to overload PLMs.

strats.name: Shinespark Kill
note: Use i-frames from the first Dessgeega to run through the remaining enemies and store a shinespark.
1-tap Shortcharge, then run back towards the Hoppers and try to hit all three at once by shinesparking horizontally as the ceiling hopper jumps down.

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: FIXME: Assumes the Kzans are in their default positions

strats.name: Leave with Runway
strats.devNote: FIXME: Assumes the Kzans are in their default positions

strats.name: Spike Kzan Kago
strats.note: Walk into a Spike and then Morph-Kago through the top Spike-Platform.
strats.devNote: About equivalent to waiting, if there is no form of damage reduction.

strats.name: Spike Kzan Kago, Leave with Runway
strats.note: Walk into a Spike and then Morph-Kago through the top Spike-Platform.
strats.devNote: About equivalent to waiting, if there is no form of damage reduction.

strats.name: Kzan Double Kago
strats.note: Morph Kago through the top Spike platform and use the i-frames to Kago again through the second.
strats.devNote: Useful when enemy damage can be reduced while still taking full heat damage.

strats.name: Missile Kill
note: Safely kill the left two Dessgeegas where the Power Bomb statue used to be.
Lure the right side Ceiling hopper to the left before dealing with it.

strats.name: Beam Kill
note: Safely kill the left two Dessgeegas where the Power Bomb statue used to be.
Lure the right side Ceiling hopper to the left before dealing with it.

strats.name: Kill Dessgeega (Medium)
strats.note: Stand crouched where the statue used to be to safely kill the Dessgeega.
strats.devNote: Hitboxing with a Power Bomb while breaking the statue is not reliable.

strats.name: Kill Dessgeega (Slow)
strats.note: Stand crouched where the statue used to be to safely kill the Dessgeega.

strats.name: Statue Clip Damage Boost (HiJump)
note: Break the Power Bomb statue leaving 1 row of blocks.
Partially clip beneath the Power Bomb blocks and the sold tiles beneath.
Wait for a Dessgeega to jump over head and jump into it.
The left ceiling Dessgeega works better.
Damage boost to the right and use i-frames to run through all of the enemies.

strats.name: HiJumpless Statue Clip Damage Boost
note: Break the Power Bomb statue leaving 1 row of blocks.
Partially clip beneath the Power Bomb blocks and the sold tiles beneath.
Wait for a Dessgeega to jump over head and jump into it.
The left ceiling Dessgeega works better.
Aim down after jumping in order to fully boost over the solid statue.
Damage boost to the right and use i-frames to run through all of the enemies.

strats.name: Statue Clip Damage Boost (HiJump, SpeedBall)
note: Break the Power Bomb statue leaving 1 row of blocks.
Partially clip beneath the Power Bomb blocks and the sold tiles beneath.
Wait for a Dessgeega to jump over head and jump into it.
The left ceiling Dessgeega works better.
Damage boost to the right and use i-frames to run through all of the enemies.
Begin shortcharging while running through the Dessgeegas for a speedball.
It may help to end the damage boost early, but then it becomes more difficult to stutter for the shortcharge.

strats.name: HiJumpless Statue Clip Damage Boost (SpeedBall)
note: Break the Power Bomb statue leaving 1 row of blocks.
Partially clip beneath the Power Bomb blocks and the sold tiles beneath.
Wait for a Dessgeega to jump over head and jump into it.
The left ceiling Dessgeega works better.
Aim down after jumping in order to fully boost over the solid statue.
Damage boost to the right and use i-frames to run through all of the enemies.
Begin shortcharging while running through the Dessgeegas for a speedball.
It may help to end the damage boost early, but then it becomes more difficult to stutter for the shortcharge.

strats.name: Power Bomb
strats.devNote: The xray climb would need to wait for the explosion.  Other strats may break the block earlier.

strats.name: Crystal Flash
devNote: FIXME: This can have a side effect of damaging the Dessgeega which is not modelled.

strats.name: Avoid Dessgeegas by Rolling
note: Roll under the Dessgeegas until all three move off camera and stop chasing Samus.
Roll directly from the Morph tunnel, past the first Dessgeega.
Stop and let it jump left of Samus, then move it off camera on the next jump.
Back away from the Left ground hopper then roll under it.
Lastly, manipulate the ceiling hopper off camera if it has followed Samus this far.

strats.name: Avoid Dessgeegas (Mockball)
note: Let the right hopper jump twice towards Samus.
At the start of the second jump, jump above where the ground Dessgeega can jump but below where the ceiling enemy can reach.
Mockball below the third hopper.
strats.devNote: FIXME: The Power Bomb from breaking the tunnel bomb block could be used for this strat.

strats.name: HeatProof Bombs Kill
note: Lure the Ground Hoppers to the Morph Tunnel
The left ceiling Dessgeega can be safely killed above the Power Bomb statue.
strats.devNote: Other Slow kill methods may need to take contact damage.

strats.name: Temporary Blue
strats.devNote: It is easier to chainTemporaryBlue than to unmorph at the correct timing.

strats.name: Crystal Flash
devNote: FIXME: This can have a side effect of damaging the Dessgeega or breaking the bomb blocks, neither of which are modeled.

strats.name: Shinespark Kill
note: Use i-frames from the first Dessgeega to run through the remaining enemies and store a shinespark.
It helps to run towards the first hopper to take damage and then not stutter.
Mid-air spark to kill all three at once.

strats.name: Avoid Hibashi
note: The hibashi hit can be avoided by waiting for the shutter to go up.
That requires the use of one PB and more time than is worth unless heat proof.
strats.devNote: Note that if using PBs, two is required. One each from h_bombThings, h_usePowerBomb.

strats.name: Crystal Flash
devNote: FIXME: This can have a side effect of damaging the Bomb block which is not modelled.

strats.name: Raise Shutter
note: Raise the shutter by shooting a missile or upgraded beam at it.
Stand on the right side of lowest safe tile and shoot diagonally down while crouched if using missiles, or standing otherwise.
A basic beam shot will work if fired vertically down, onto the side of the spike.
devNote: Power Bombs is handled by another strat.

strats.name: G-Mode, Collect the Item and Go Down Blind
note: Exit G-mode while on the item pedestal, while off-camera, then return to the right through the Dessgeega that can't damage Samus off-screen.
Use a Power Bomb and fall down the spiky shaft and get to the door. Avoiding a spike hit is possible but tricky.
strats.devNote: FIXME: Strats could be added on remote acquire strats that use the item for the escape, such as Morph, explosives, or an E-Tank.

strats.name: G-Mode, Go Down Blind
note: With a way to move while morphed, use a Power Bomb while on the Power Bomb blocks and quickly exit G-mode.
Otherwise, do so to the right of the Power Bomb blocks, quickly exit G-mode, and jump up and over to fall through the blocks.
Fall down the spiky shaft and get to the door. Avoiding a spike hit is possible but tricky.

strats.name: G-Mode, Collect the Item and Return to the Right
note: Exit G-mode while on the item pedestal, while off-camera, then return to the right through the Dessgeegas that can't damage Samus off-screen.
It is possible to use a Power Bomb and quickly exiting G-mode to have the bomb block broken on exit,
but this will also partially break the Power Bomb blocks and could make exit traversal less straightforward.
strats.devNote: FIXME: The Hibashi doesn't need a 4th PB in the power bomb case.

strats.name: G-Mode, Blind Temporary Blue and Speedball
note: Use Speedbooster to break the bomb block near the item to collect it and then again to speedball back to the door.

strats.name: G-Mode, Collect the Item and Reset Camera in the Right Morph Tunnel
note: Exit G-mode while on the item pedestal, while off-camera, then return to the right through the Dessgeegas that can't damage Samus off-screen.
It is possible to use a Power Bomb and quickly exiting G-mode to have the bomb block broken on exit,
but this will also partially break the Power Bomb blocks and could make exit traversal less straightforward.

notables.name: Statue Clip Damage Boost
note: Break the Power Bomb statue leaving 1 row of blocks.
Partially clip between the Power Bomb blocks and the solid tiles beneath.
Wait for a Dessgeega to jump over head and jump into it.
The left ceiling Dessgeega works better.
Damage boost to the right and use i-frames to run through all of the enemies.

note: Break the Power Bomb statue leaving 1 row of blocks.
Partially clip between the Power Bomb blocks and the solid tiles beneath.
Wait for a Dessgeega to jump over head and jump into it.
The left ceiling Dessgeega works better.
Aim down after jumping in order to fully boost over the solid statue.
Damage boost to the right and use i-frames to run through all of the enemies.

notables.name: Avoid Dessgeegas by Rolling
note: Roll under the Dessgeegas until all three move off camera and stop chasing Samus.
Roll directly from the Morph tunnel, past the first Dessgeega.
Stop and let it jump left of Samus, then move it off camera on the next jump.
Back away from the Left ground hopper then roll under it.
Lastly, manipulate the ceiling hopper off camera if it has followed Samus this far.
